text:
iPhones could soon cost up to $2,300 in the U.S. due to tariffs 

iPhone prices could rise by 43%, meaning the base iPhone 16 model could start at $1,142 and the most expensive iPhone 16 Pro Max model could cost up to $2,300 

Source: @Reuters

What a silly headline. The market would not tolerate those prices, so Apple would never set them. 

They simply will not make as much profit per phone and they will squeeze their suppliers.

If this ends up happening, I see consumers choosing to:

•pay the extra money, because they see it as a worthwhile expense

•wait longer to upgrade, and trade in their older device for a discount at their carrier 

•buy off the used market.
If the price of the iPhone is $2300, this will be catastrophic for iPhone sales as it will decrease a lot.
